subject: In the Land of Fish and Chips
event: Made it across the pond safely.  Parris got her first platter of fish 'n chips last night, and pronounced it ghood.  Today we're recovering from jet lag.

comments.article:
Meh, you ain't properly arrived until you come up to Yorkshire and have a good, proper Yorkshire pudding. :P

lol. Glad to hear you both arrived safely.

I had a steak n kindey pie. Does that count?

HOT PIE! HOT PIE!!
Okay, I just have to ask - do you get recognized a lot on your travels? :)

yes, but not so much that it bothers me

happens more often if i'm wearing the hat
Ooh. First ever, or just first of the trip?
Steak and Kidney Pie... Yorkshire Pudding... Fish and Chips... Mail me some to Korea please!
Tell Parris she needs to come up to Anstruther for some properly good fish'n'chips. ;) Looking forward to seeing you both next weekend!
I would love to have ADWD signed when it has been translated to Spanish, will you come to Barcelona?
comments.subject: Are you preparing some kind of tour around Spain?

comments.article:
not a big tour, but we intend to come to Celsius 232 in Asturias which is taking place instead of the wonderful long-established Semana Negra in Gijon this summer.

check George's appearances page on his web site from time to time, where we update his plans when they have been confirmed and we can be confident that the events will take place.
comments.subject: Re: Are you preparing some kind of tour around Spain?

comments.article:
Fish and Chips is a good restorative. :)

Hope you have a good trip!
I hope you had mushy peas as well, and gravy ;)

If I have to go to the dentist on a bright sunny morning like today, at least I have a dentist who spent the entire time waxing lyrical about Game of Thrones.

Thank you for inspiring my dentist!
Hope you enjoy your stay! :)
When will your travels bring you to Wisconsin, good sir? Fish and chips? Pshaw! We have cheese.

Make sure to sample more of our traditional British delicacies, such as Chicken Tikka Masala and Special Fried Rice ;-)

Welcome, and hope you have a fun time.

comments.upictitle: Madam Lulzy the Great: Deedlit Relaxing
comments.article: Well. I read "fish and chips" and now I'm looking at my oatmeal with severe distaste. Why can't it magically turn into delicious fish and chpis?!
But oatmeal is good too! Especially with lots'nlots of sugar .... and no lumps!
yummy...fish n chips sounds excellent, especially since I haven't yet had lunch. Glad to know you both made it there safely. Hope you have a great trip and have a great time.
I wonder would it be possible to sign a book somewhere in London
comments.subject: Book signing

comments.article:
Fish'n'chips are great! Hope you had proper cod or a nice whale-sized haddock, and plenty of salt and vinegar on your 'chippy chips!'

I can't make it down to London or Bath, but I hope you have a great time in our proud little country and that you find us welcoming and friendly (most of us are okay) - you timed it right with the weather too!

Quick question too - is 'The North' of Westeros loosely based on England and Scotland?
comments.subject: Welcome to England!

comments.article: You should try the Cornish pasty sir! Delicious...
You will get much better 'fish and chips' in New Zealand ... just sayin'!!  ;)
I'm hoping this is a joke.

George, I've always wondered: what do you like to drink? Lately I've taken to Irish stuff (Smithwicks, Guiness, Harp, Kilkenny for beers, ales & lagers, and some whiskey & scotch from time to time. I recommend "Irish Mist"). nothing beats a good ol pint of something Irish with some pub fare (burger, mixed-meat stew, shepherd's pie, and of course, fish 'n' chips.

Also, I'm not being critical or anything negative here, but merely curious: what's the story behind 'the hat'?

I hope you are doing well, and your various projects go smoothly.

Just curious, but do you write when you travel? (Or is that one of your I'd-tell-you-but-then-I'd-have-to-kill-you trade secrets?)

Hope you have a fun (and safe) trip!
comments.subject: Out of curiosity...

comments.article: oh what i woudn't give for some steak & kidney pie or some fish & chips!! lol, anyways, hope you have an awesome time overseas, and still waiting for you to announce a visit to mexico :)

Wow all that travelling must wear you out!
Don't overwork yourself too much.

But remember to enjoy all the foods you encounter!
Uh oh....swiped Manningham and Jacobs.  The Manningham signing makes me smile....Jacobs makes me wonder WTF.  See you in the playoffs.  :)

Sounds like a great time :)
Enjoy your trip!

Gravy and mushy peas to go with those chips i hope, have a great trip alas this time i wont make it over but still have the books you signed for me in Colchester a few years ago before becoming 'famous'
